diagnosis.final_diagnosis: symptomatic mania related to phencyclidine abuse
diagnosis.differential_diagnosis: tardive dyskinesia, depressive neurosis, passive-dependent personality, catatonic schizophrenia
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient developed manic-like symptoms following the use of phencyclidine, and his presentation was consistent with a manic episode. Symptoms persisted longer than expected relative to the drug's half-life and responded minimally to neuroleptics but improved significantly with ECT and subsequently lithium carbonate. The absence of prior psychiatric history and a return to baseline functioning after effective treatment supported the diagnosis of symptomatic mania.
